basics.name: Suraj Bhardwaj
basics.label: AI Researcher & Data Scientist
basics.summary: AI and data science professional with expertise in deep learning, LLMs, and computer vision. Experienced in developing scalable, research-driven ML systems and deploying them using modern MLOps tools.

work.name: Fraunhofer IOSB
work.summary: Conducted AI research for human-machine interaction and autonomous driving projects (KARLI, SALSA).
highlights: Developed an LLM-based chatbot using RAG and RAPTOR for scalable retrieval in knowledge-intensive settings.
Designed the Clustered Feature Weighting (CFW) algorithm to mitigate class imbalance in multimodal datasets.
Contributed to VoxelNeXt deployment for LiDAR-based 3D object detection on the Pandaset dataset.
Led technical demos of a Level 3 Mercedes-Benz Occupant Monitoring System for stakeholders.
Worked with Python, PyTorch, Ray, FAISS, RAPTOR, LangChain, Docker, Streamlit, and AWS.

work.name: Fraunhofer IOSB
work.position: Master Thesis Researcher – Improved Driver Distraction Detection using Self-Supervised Learning
work.summary: Investigated cross-modality generalization using self-supervised vision transformers for driver distraction detection.
highlights: Innovated the Clustered Feature Weighting (CFW) algorithm using HDBSCAN for long-tailed distribution.
Achieved 7.17% performance improvement over supervised baselines using DINOv2-pretrained ViT-B/14.
Used tools like Ray, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, OpenCV, and Git for reproducible experimentation.

volunteer.organization: IEEE ITSC 2025 (International Conference on Intelligent Transportation Systems)
volunteer.summary: Served as a peer reviewer for the IEEE ITSC 2025 conference in the domains of machine learning and computer vision.
highlights: Reviewed submissions in unsupervised learning, segmentation, and safe motion generation.
Focused on evaluating methods in ML, CV, and intelligent systems for transportation and autonomous driving.

education.area: Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science

publications.name: Self-supervised Driver Distraction Detection for Imbalanced Datasets
publications.publisher: IEEE 28th International Conference on Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITSC 2025)
publications.summary: Proposed a novel unsupervised adaptation strategy to address class imbalance and enhance generalization in computer vision tasks — directly applicable to clinical AI settings with limited or unlabelled data.

publications.name: Effect of Size and Cascading of Receivers on the Performance of a Solar Collector System
publications.summary: This study examines how cascading configurations in parabolic dish solar collectors improve collection efficiency by 3.2%–5.4%, highlighting the impact of receiver size and layout on thermal performance.

projects.name: YOLO-Based Real-Time Object Detection in CARLA
projects.summary: Developed and deployed a real-time object detection system using YOLOv8–YOLOv11 models in CARLA simulator on a Tesla Model 3 setup.
highlights: Simulated a sensor suite with 8 cameras, radar, and 12 ultrasonic sensors at 30 FPS.
Trained and evaluated 12 YOLO models on a custom dataset; YOLO8-m and YOLO11-m achieved best mAP@(50–95) scores.
Integrated the fine-tuned YOLO11-m model into the CARLA pipeline for live inference on cars, pedestrians, and traffic signs.

projects.name: RAG Chatbot using NVIDIA NIM
projects.summary: Implemented a Streamlit-based chatbot leveraging NVIDIA NIM and LangChain for querying research PDFs with contextual awareness.
highlights: Utilized RAPTOR, FAISS, and ChromaDB for retrieval-augmented generation.
Designed for scalable, domain-specific document understanding.

projects.name: Codeninja: AI Code Assistant
projects.summary: Developed an LLM-based code assistant using Ollama, Gradio, and LangChain to enhance developer productivity.
highlights: Integrated with a custom model served locally.
Provided contextual, real-time code generation and fixes.

projects.name: Implicit 3D Model Generation
projects.summary: Built an implicit 3D object generator using Neural Unsigned Distance Fields (NDF) and latent diffusion.
highlights: Trained on ShapeNet Cars using SLURM on OMNI cluster.
Implemented vector quantization and feature bottlenecks.

projects.name: OOD Robustness with AugMix
projects.summary: Evaluated OOD robustness of ConvNeXt and ResNet18 on CIFAR variants using AugMix augmentation.
highlights: Applied transfer learning and tuning with cosine LR scheduling.
Achieved superior robustness scores for ConvNeXt-tiny.

projects.name: Real-Time Face Mask Detection
projects.summary: Built a VGG16-based face mask detector with live webcam stream input using OpenCV and Haar cascades.
highlights: Achieved 93.5% accuracy in real-time prediction pipeline.
Applied transfer learning on VGG16 features.
